Notes: The Samford University Library established its Department of Special Collections in 1957 to assemble original sources and secondary materials in several areas: Alabama local and family history; records of congregational, association, and state convention activities of Baptists and other denominations in the state; and materials documenting the history of Samford University and individuals associated with the school from its formation in 1841 to the present.  Holdings include 1,389 cubic feet of manuscript and archival material; 24,000 books and pamphlets; oral histories, still pictures, artifacts, maps, and newspapers.  Other significant subject areas include travel in Alabama and the southeast and the Albert E. Casey Collection on Irish history.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
